context.p: Verify connectivity between the machines youâ€™ll be installing Eucalyptus on. Some Linux distributions provide default TCP/IP firewalling rules that limit network access to machines. Disable these default firewall settings before you install Eucalyptus components to ensure that the components can communicate with one another.
Verify component connectivity by performing the following checks on the machines that will be running the listed Eucalyptus components.

step.cmd: Verify connection from and end-user to the CLC on ports 8773 and 8443
Verify connection from an end-user to Walrus on port 8773
Verify connection from the CLC, SC, and NC (or VB) to Walrus on port 8773
Verify connection from Walrus, SC, and VB to CLC on port 8777
Verify connection from CLC to CC on port 8774
Verify connection from CC to VB on port 8773
Verify connection from CC to NC on port 8775
Verify connection from NC (or VB) to Walrus on port 8773. Or, you can verify the connection from the CC to Walrus on port 8773, and from an NC to the CC on port 8776
Verify connection from public IP addresses of Eucalyptus instances (metadata) and CC to CLC on port 8773
Verify TCP connectivity between CLC, Walrus, SC and VB
Verify connection between CLC, Walrus, SC, and VB on UDP ports 7500 and 8773
If you use tgt (iSCSI open source target) for EBS storage, verify connection from NC to SC on port 3260
If you use VMware with Eucalyptus, verify the connection from the VMware Broker to VMware (ESX, VSphere).
